LEAD: Mike Webster, the center who surprised the Pittsburgh Steelers on Friday by announcing his retirement, surprised them again today by saying he would return next season.
Mike Webster, the center who surprised the Pittsburgh Steelers on Friday by announcing his retirement, surprised them again today by saying he would return next season.

''I hadn't really planned to retire in the first place,'' he said. ''If I was really going to retire I would have done it after the season and gotten on with my life's work.'' Webster, a 14-year veteran, is the last active Steeler with four Super Bowl rings.
Webster said he came to an ''understanding'' with Dan Rooney, the Steelers president, over the weekend.
''We might not be able to agree on it, but friends can disagree I think and still be friends,'' said Webster, who has a contract for 1988 worth an estimated $330,000, and an option for 1989.
